title: Tony Pulis refuses to discuss Saido Berahino after it was revealed the striker did serve an eight-week FA ban while at West Brom
text:
EFL Sai no more Tony Pulis refuses to discuss Saido Berahino after it was revealed the striker did serve an eight-week FA ban while at West Brom 
Berahino was banned after failing an out-of-competition drugs test while at the Hawthorns By GRAEME BRYCE Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments TONY PULIS admitted Saido Berahino DID serve an eight-week suspension at West Brom – but refused to discuss the matter further. Berahino moved to Stoke in the January transfer window saido berahino inhales nitrous oxide west brom 
But former Potters boss Pulis told reporters the ban was nothing to do with why he refused to pick Berahino. 
Keep up to date with ALL the West Brom news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Pulis said: "He served a ban here at West Brom I don’t really want to comment on the reason why. 
"I’ll go back to what I said then and I’ll say it again Saido didn’t play regular for me because he wasn’t fit enough – for whatever reason. 
“I wasn’t counting. Whatever it was it was. The reason Saido didn’t play for me was because he wasn’t fit enough. 
“We can’t, I can’t comment on that – that’s something other people will have to do first. 
"What I have to be careful with now is Saido is no longer a West Brom player he plays for a former club of mine who I have tremendous respect for. PA:Press Association Saido Berahino served an eight-week suspension for drug use related stories Sai no more Tony Pulis refuses to discuss Saido Berahino after it was revealed the striker DID serve an eight-week drug ban BERA DRUGS SHAME Saido Berahino failed drugs test at West Brom and was suspended for eight weeks by the FA before signing for Stoke Ready, Saidy, Go New Stoke star Saido Berahino ready to prove himself to Premier League and unleash his true potential TEAM NEWS Stoke vs Everton team news: Stoke vs Everton team news: Seamus Coleman makes 200th Premier league appearance for Toffees while Saido Berahino is on the bench for Stoke SHOOTING STAR Stoke's £15m striker Saido Berahino shows off incredible basketball skills in an arcade Stoke the fire Saido Berahino says West Brom hell saw him falsely accused of being fat and left mum Liliane 'heartbroken' Getty Images 5 Saido Berahino served the ban at West Brom before his £15million switch to Stoke 
"In this situation I think it’s better they deal with the situation from where they are with the player. 
"Mark questioned why I wasn’t picking Saido – he has got the answers." 
"Two, he was serving an FA ban. We are under an obligation not to. It was a personal matter. 
"We’re under strict obligations not to release any of that information. That’s an FA directive." 
And Pulis confessed he did feel let down by Berahino but he accepted the situation. Reuters 5 Tony Pulis said he did not play Berahino because the player was not fit enough 
He added: "Let down? I feel let down if we lose a game, with certain people’s performances. 
"I feel let down if people are late for training. 
"I feel let down if I go home and have dinner and the food’s not as hot as I’d like it to be so I’m always getting let down, here there and everywhere. You just have to accept it." PA:Press Association 5 Saido Berahino says it was the Baggies who made life difficult for him and not the other way round 
Pulis was quick to add that Berahino was well looked after by the club before his move to the Bet365 Stadium. 
He added: “This football club was absolutely fantastic towards Saido. 
"The way they treated him and what they’ve done for him, in lots of ways over that short period – but ever since I’ve been at this football club it has looked after its players and Saido more than most, has really been looked after." 
Stoke boss Mark Hughes confirmed there had been an "FA disciplinary matter" and that "Saido had an eight-week suspension". Middlesbrough 1-1 West Brom : James Morrison nets before Alvaro Negredo equalises
